children.subject:
fwiw, I feel like the typical answer for most students (unless you truly pick up material at a really fast rate or know you can handle a massive workload and still be stay sane) for "should I take [x technical class] with a full-time internship" is no.

A full-time internship is already a lot of work, and it will be a new type of work that you possibly haven't experienced before so I wouldn' t stack on classes that you're only gonna get to work on after you get home (or disconnect your final work call) on top of everything else. Based on the classes you've asked about, I'm assuming this might be your first internship? Congrats! I'd really just focus more on making the best of the internship experience itself than trying to have a loaded summer-- spend some time connecting/socializing with your fellow interns, do your best work, etc etc.
Why do you think I would be able to handle it if it is a SWE internship?
If you landed a SWE internship, then I assume that you studied enough data structures/algorithms for the interviews? Although 61BL is probably more than just that, please use your best judgement.

Unless you have some knowledge of data structures and algorithms or this internship is a SWE internship? Other than that, the answer is probably no for the same reasons that anon mouse pointed out. 

Think about it, you say it's a 40 hour internship so that must equate to ~8 hours per day. On top of that you're going to have 3 hour lab nearly every weekday. That's already 11 hours every weekday that you have to set aside. Plus add time to work on projects and assignments. And then you have to set aside time for studying for midterms and finals depending on how that works out due to COVID-19 and remote instruction. I'd rather solely focus on an internship and get good performance for a stable return offer or good networking. Who knows? Maybe you'll learn some 61B material in your internship and do really well in the Fall?

history.content:
I’ll leave “can handle or not” to yourself, but just FYI, summer 61B’s projects follow Hilfinger’s mainly.

Hopefully that is enough said lol

Hi everyone!

Would it be recommended to do 61B with a 40hr/week internship in the summer? In particular, I want to understand how is the workload of the projects in the summer and how difficult it would be to handle it with a 40 hr internship, if at all it can be done?

Thanks a lot!
history.subject: 61B and Summer internship
